page.title: 06FARMING - THE LAND
page.content: This area is mainly rural and most of the land to the north and east of Houston is used for agriculture and forestry. Grass is the main crop in the area because of the cool moist summers and mild wet winters experienced in this western part of Scotland. Soil varies from heavy, sticky, stony clays on the higher ground,black,peaty soils on the flat land to the east,and sandy or silty soils along the River Gryffe. The landscape is of scattered patches of mixed woodland, smallish fields bounded by stone dykes on the higher ground to larger rectangular fields bounded by hawthorn hedges on the lower ground. There are some large patches of conifers to the east. Lines of trees shelter fields from the prevailing westerlies.
